[{"text":"Build a RESTful API implementing CRUD operations for an entity like Book, User, or Product.
·       Use Gin framework.
·       JSON request/response handling with encoding/json pkg.
·       Store data in memory.
Handle proper HTTP error responses and validation

Add secure authentication to your Go API using JWT.
·       Implement user login/logout and token generation.
·       Use github.com/golang-jwt/jwt/v5 pkg.
·       Protect routes using custom middleware.
·       Bonus: Implement refresh tokens and role-based access control.
 
3. Go Modules and Project Structure
Objective: Organize your application using the idiomatic Go project layout.
·       Initialize with go mod init.
·       Use clean architecture: cmd/, internal/, pkg/.
·       Demonstrate versioned dependency management.

Build a job queue system using goroutines and channels.
·       Accept and queue tasks via HTTP or CLI.
·       Create a worker pool to process jobs.
·       Use context for cancellation and graceful shutdown.
·       Implement structured logging.

Persist data using relational databases.
·       UseMySQL with GORM.
·       Implement complete CRUD with persistent storage.
·       Use transactions for data integrity.
·       Handle database migrations and connection pooling.

Unit Testing and TDD
Objective: Write clean, tested, and test-driven code.
·       Use Go's testing package and httptest.
·       Write unit tests for handlers and business logic.
·       Apply table-driven tests.
·       Cover 80% code coverage.

Middleware and Context Handling
Objective: Build reusable components for cross-cutting concerns.
·       Create custom middleware for logging, authentication, etc.
·       Use context.Context pkg to manage request data and timeouts.
·       Handle panic recovery and graceful termination.
 
8. File Upload and File Handling
Objective: Accept and manage file uploads on a Go server.
·       Use multipart form handling to accept files.
·       Save files to disk or cloud (optional).
·       Perform basic file I/O using os and io.
9. gRPC Integration
Objective: Add real-time or high-performance communication.
·       gRPC server and client using Protocol Buffers.
·       Include sample client implementation.
 
10. Dockerize a Go Application
Objective: Containerize your application for deployment.
·       Create a multi-stage Dockerfile to build and run your app.
·       Use docker-compose for local setup with DB services.
·       Optimize for small image size and fast startup.
 
11. Scheduled Jobs / Cron Tasks
Objective: Run background jobs on a schedule.
·       Use any cron pkg.
·       Implement cleanup, email sending, or reporting tasks.
·       Include error handling and logging.
